intro: Gymnopsis connata, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrplant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces oval, spiny fruits that are adapted for dispersal by animals. Gymnopsis connata is often found in dry, sandy soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of desert flora.
